SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To report the efficacy of intravitreal bevacizumab injection in treatment of macular edema in a case of optic disc vasculitis
METHODS: A patient diagnosed with macular edema due to optic disc vasculitis was treated with intravitreal bevacizumab injection
RESULTS: One week after injection, fundus appearance dramatically improved and macular edema regressed
The patient was followed up for 1 year after injection and there was no recurrence of macular edema
CONCLUSIONS: This case suggests that intravitreal bevacizumab treatment might be effective in the management of macular edema in patients with optic disc vasculitis
